BY.note:
"Belarusian authorities used a bomb scare and scrambled a fighter jet to force a plane flying between two EU member states to land in Minsk on Sunday to arrest a journalist on board. The act was condemned by the United States and Europe as a danger to all civilian flights.
https://www.afr.com/world/asia/chinese-dissidents-fear-belarus-hijacking-precedent-20210525-p57v1b"

CL.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
CL.note: The situation could change rapidely to "significant" if more specific records of politically motivated attacks appear. Now, it is only one case three years ago and direct testimonies I collected from the Chinese community. They reported that they were pressured to be quiet about political affairs and attacked when they didn't.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

GR.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
GR.note: While there are no reported cases of such activity by local criminal groups, there is some alleged presence of Chinese mafia cells in Greece, who proceed in coercive, intimidating and punitive tactics, possibly even resulting in murder. Nevertheless, it should be made perfectly clear that such activity is targeted towards Chinese individuals residing in Greece.The reasons behind any possible harassment vary, and may definately include dissidence and the adoption of a critical disposition towards the PRC by member of the Chinese diaspora.
GR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MK.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
MK.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TR.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
TR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

IS.evidence: This would have made it to the local media. We have incidences of this happening on behalf of Russian diplomats threatening companies and news papers and it is a) reported to the police, and b) always makes headlines.
IS.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PT.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
PT.note: Although the country being analysed is Portugal, it is important to note the special case of Macau, in which Portuguese Rule of Law was supposed to apply until 2049. Unfortunately, reality has proven otherwise. This is relevant for the many Portuguese citizens living in Macau. There have been instances in Macau of Portuguese lawyers, for instance, who have been targeted and are subject to intimidation. The case of lawyer Jorge Menezes is, unfortunately, a good example of this reality.
PT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

RO.evidence: We could not identify any instance of criminal groups threatening Chinese dissidents in Romania. In fact, such dissidents are not very visible in society, apart from the Falun Gong members who carry out peaceful, non-political activities
RO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

MD.evidence: Local criminal groups with political agenda do exist in Moldova, but they have nothing to do with the PRC and its interests
MD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

IT.evidence: There is a significant presence of Triad activity in Italy, some of it has been reported to manifest with repression, but this is almost exclusively restricted to the immigrant Chinese population.
IT.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

NL.evidence: While the Triad is certainly present in the Netherlands (especially in the port areas), there is little evidence that they engage in active repression against even the local Chinese speaking population, as local authorities are heavily invested in rooting them out. It is highly unlikely that organized crime is targeting individuals based on political reasons.
NL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

UA.evidence: We are not aware of such cases.
UA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Mădălina Voinea and Sorin Ionita

ES.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PY.answerer: Answered by Hernan Alberro, and has been reviewed by Julieta Heduvan

PK.evidence: On the contrary, separatist militant groups have attacked and killed Chinese and Pakistani individuals working on BRI projects.
PK.answerer: Answered by Shahzeb Jillani, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AF.evidence: There is fear of being targeted or psychological fear among Uyghur dissidents in Afghanistan, stemming from the former Afghan government and the Taliban, who cooperate with the PRC. However, Uyghur militants in Afghanistan have expressed their readiness to oppose the PRC.
AF.answerer: Answered by Rahimullah Kakar, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

TM.answerer: Answered by Temur Umarov, and has been reviewed by Niva Yau

IN.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
IN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZA.evidence: Chinese criminals have bribed officials in South African businesses, but there is no evidence that they have done so to coerce people critical of the PRC. They are primarily involved in trafficking in migrants and abalone and the importation of counterfeit goods and gold together with narcotics, laundering money, and dealing in prostitution.
ZA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

SN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ET.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

KE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

SG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TW.evidence: The gangs related with Chinese Unification Promotion Party have taken part in the violent protest against the Hong Kong activist Joshua Wong, and splashing red paint to the Hong Kong singer/ activist Denise Ho. Also, the shooting to the Taiwanese influencer Holger Chen revealed to be done by pro-unification gangs after investigation. However, the gangs have been keeping a lower profile since 2020.
TW.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

BR.evidence: No evidence was found of organized local criminal groups who threatened or used violence to coerce, intimidate or punish Chinese dissidents. The Chinese mafia, according to evidence found in the survey, practices extortion, threats and uses violence with compatriots in case of non-payment of "protection fees". Issues of threats or the use of violence to punish Chinese dissidents seems to us to be out of Brazil's reality.
BR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

CZ.evidence: There was just one exception when General Secretary Xi Jinping visited Prague in 2016. The organized groups of Chinese people were attacking the protesters against Xi`s visit, while the police either did not help, or participated in hiding the Tibetan and Uyghur flags.
CZ.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

EE.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
EE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

PL.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
PL.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

VN.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
VN.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

NP.evidence: In 2023, Nepal Congress politician was attacked after criticising the Chinese Envoy who had foul-mouthed Delhi-Kathmandu ties
NP.answerer: Answered by Sriparna Pathak, and has been reviewed by Amish Mulmi

RU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

NZ.answerer: Answered by Catherine Churchman, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZW.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
ZW.answerer: Answered by Ernest Mudzengi and 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula and Dr. Obert Hodzi

CD.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
CD.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Andronicus Sikula

MY.evidence: Triads in Malaysia does not only include chinese dissidents, because the traids are joined later by different communities other than the initial chinese dissidents, but news about them has been lessen and lessen these days. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "few" rating. However, they don't seem to be having an issue with the Chinese (the PRC)'s influence, neither do the latter. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "insignificant" rating.
MY.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TL.evidence: Thus far, this has not been reported.
TL.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AR.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
AR.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

UY.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

SV.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
SV.answerer: Answered by Eric Lemus, and has been reviewed by Julio Martinez and Alvaro Cruz

PH.evidence: There are no available public information discussing local criminal groups, including the triad, in action in the Philippines recently. However, the Triad influence is still rampant in the country which has been the suspect for many criminal activities, including drug trafficking.
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 3 anonymous experts.

TH.evidence: There is no indicator of the said phenomenon.
TH.answerer: Answered by Pravit Rojanaphruk, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MM.evidence: Though there are local criminal gangs operating in PRC investment areas, there are no reported cases of violence, coercion, intimidation, or individuals critical of the PRC being punished.
MM.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

UG.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
UG.answerer: Answered by Abdou Rahim Lema, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MZ.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
MZ.answerer: Answered by Tomé Bambo, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AO.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
AO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

JP.evidence: A news report of Chinese "secret police" assaulting Chinese pro-democracy activitsts in Japan. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These activities by secret police are linked to political repression and sometimes life-threatening. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
JP.answerer: Answered by Yuki Moritarni, and has been reviewed by Maiko Ichihara and Ryohei Suzuki

ID.evidence: We are unable to find any source which indicates it
ID.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

KR.evidence: There are many Chinese organized crime felons. It is not sure whether they threaten Chinese dissidents.
KR.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

SA.evidence: We are unable to find any source which indicates it
SA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

QA.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
QA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

CA.evidence: There is no observation of this phenomenon.
CA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Terry Glavin

KH.evidence: Yes, a small number of cases - known via interviews - names cannot be shared to protect interviewees.
KH.answerer: Answered by Bradley J. Murg, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

US.evidence: In 2023, a federal jury convicted three defendants on multiple counts of a superseding indictment charging them with acting and conspiring to act in the United States as illegal agents of the People’s Republic of China (PRC). The defendants' actions included salking and harrassment. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. These cases of transnational repression have chilling effects on civil liberties throughout the United States. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
US.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

DE.evidence: There are by German law criminal actions where Chinese dissidents or critics living in Germany have been intimidated and harassed. These criminals have not been identified as yet, but it can be assumed that this is part of an institutionalized campaign.
DE.answerer: Answered by Angela Stanzel, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GB.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this statement.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this claim in the affirmative.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
